title: New ultra-diffuse galaxy discovered in formation 430 million light years away - Deccan Herald
summary:
New ultra-diffuse galaxy discovered in formation 430 million light years away

Published: 09 January 2025, 23:10 IST

Bengaluru: Astronomers have discovered a new ultra-diffuse galaxy under formation at the end of the tidal tail of galaxy NGC 3785, located approximately 430 million light years from Earth in the Leo constellation.

  • The discovery was made by a collaborative team from the Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Pondicherry University, the SKA Observatory in the UK, and the National Centre for Radio Astronomy in Pune.
  • The new galaxy's formation resulted from gravitational interactions between NGC 3785 and a neighboring galaxy.
  • Ultra-diffuse galaxies are characterized by being less bright and less massive than typical galaxies.
  • The tidal tail of NGC 3785 is formed from a 'flyby' interaction, rather than a merger.
  • It has the longest tidal tail ever observed, stretching for 1.27 million light years.
  • Further investigation into this formation may enhance understanding of galaxy evolution.
“We found that the tidal tail stretches for 1.27 million light years, making it the longest tidal tail ever discovered in an isolated environment.” - Chandan Watts

Understanding this ultra-diffuse galaxy offers insights into the processes governing galaxy formation and evolution.
newTitle: New ultra-diffuse galaxy discovered in formation 430 million light years away

Safe, affordable solid-state nuclear clocks could be closer with thin-film technology - Interesting Engineering
summary:
Solid-state nuclear clocks could be closer with thin-film technology

Updated: January 09, 2025 04:19 PM EST

The successful use of thin films marks a potential turning point in the development of nuclear clocks, leveraging physical vapor deposition to make clock technology more practical and accessible.

  • Researchers at JILA and NIST found a method to reduce the amount of the rare isotope thorium-229 needed for nuclear clocks.
  • Thin-film technology allows for the development of nuclear clocks that are significantly less radioactive and expensive.
  • This new approach could enable nuclear clocks to be used outside laboratory settings, making them compact and portable.
  • The use of thin films could lead to improvements in the precision and stability of timekeeping.
“Thorium-229 by weight is more expensive than some of the custom proteins I’ve worked with in the past,” - Jake Higgins, JILA researcher.

This breakthrough in thin-film technology may change the future of timekeeping, providing a new avenue for developing solid-state nuclear clocks that are both less hazardous and more efficient.
newTitle: Solid-state Nuclear Clocks Enhanced by Thin-Film Technology

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim runs Geekbench, disappoints - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim runs Geekbench, disappoints

Date: January 22, 2023
Source: GSM Arena

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim, set to be unveiled alongside three other models, has shown disappointing performance in preliminary Geekbench tests. It features Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC and 12GB of RAM, running Android 15 with One UI 7.

  • Prototype model identified as SM-S937U for North America.
  • Recorded a single-core score of 3,005 and a multi-core score of 6,945, considered low for its chipset.
  • Concerns have been raised about the potential impact of its slim design on performance and heat dissipation.
  • Rumored to be under 7mm thin, raising questions about durability and usability with cases.
"That's a very low multi-core score for this chipset which generally goes up to the high 9,000s."

The performance issues of the Galaxy S25 Slim highlight a potential trade-off between design aesthetics and technical capabilities.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim runs Geekbench, disappoints

Advisory on HMPV virus by Health Dept - The Tribune India
summary:
Health Department Issues Advisory on HMPV Virus

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: The Tribune

The Health Department has issued an advisory about the Human Meta Pneumo Virus (HMPV), advising the public to remain calm as it is similar to the common cold.

  • The virus has not been reported in Punjab so far.
  • Symptoms include mild fever, runny nose, cough, sore throat, and difficulty breathing.
  • Symptoms typically improve on their own within a week.
  • Extra care is necessary for children under five and elderly individuals over sixty.
  • Recommendations include eating nutritious homemade food and avoiding crowded places if experiencing flu-like symptoms.
“There are no cases reported in Punjab as of yet,” said Civil Surgeon Hoshiarpur Dr Pawan Shagotra.

In conclusion, the public is urged to stay informed but not panic, as monitoring continues.
newTitle: Health Department Issues Advisory on HMPV Virus

title: THESE work habits are putting your sleep at risk, says study - The Times of India
summary:
THESE work habits are putting your sleep at risk, says study

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The study underscores the impact of modern work habits on sleep health, suggesting that sedentary roles and irregular work hours are key contributors to insomnia.

  • 80% of the modern workforce is highly sedentary.
  • Surveyed more than 10,000 employees over a decade.
  • Those with sedentary jobs have a 37% higher risk of insomnia symptoms.
  • Individuals with non-traditional work hours have a 66% greater chance of needing 'catch-up sleep.'
  • 90% of insomnia-like sleepers had persistent symptoms over a decade.
“The way we are designing work poses serious, long-term threats to healthy sleep.” - Claire Smith

Employers are encouraged to redesign jobs to enhance employee sleep health, which is critical for overall well-being and productivity.
newTitle: Work Habits That Risk Sleep, Says Study

title: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front' - News18
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News18

Legendary former cricketer-turned-broadcaster Sunil Gavaskar believes that Jasprit Bumrah could be India's next captain after Rohit Sharma, potentially taking over 'very soon'.

  • Gavaskar highlighted Bumrah's leadership qualities, stating he 'leads from the front' and effectively supports his bowlers without adding pressure.
  • Bumrah has already led India in key matches, including two Tests in Australia.
  • Rohit Sharma's availability and future as captain are under review after India's performance against Australia.
  • The BCCI is expected to hold a review meeting regarding India's leadership future.
  • Bumrah's role as vice-captain positions him as a strong contender, although workload management might be a concern.
“He could be the next man. I think he will be the next man. Because he leads from the front. He has got a very good air about him. The air of a leader.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The discussion surrounding India’s captaincy continues, with significant implications for the team's future performance and strategy.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma

Parvesh Verma hits back at Arvind Kejriwal: 'Gripped with fear of...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parvesh Verma said Arvind Kejriwal would soon start blaming the electronic voting machines for his defeat.

Date: Jan 09, 2025 10:55 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, BJP candidate Parvesh Verma criticized Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal, stating that Kejriwal is fearful of losing in the upcoming elections and is using voter list discrepancies as an excuse.

  • Verma accuses Kejriwal of being gripped by fear of electoral defeat.
  • Kejriwal raised concerns about irregularities in the voter registration process for the New Delhi assembly.
  • Kejriwal reported that 5.5% of the New Delhi assembly votes were registered in just 22 days, suggesting possible fraud.
  • Verma claims that Kejriwal's popularity is declining among voters in New Delhi.
"Arvind Kejriwal is scared. The fear of losing has gripped him... Soon, he will start blaming EVMs for his defeat." - Parvesh Verma

The tension between the two leaders highlights the contentious atmosphere leading up to the elections as both parties prepare for a fierce electoral battle in New Delhi.
newTitle: Parvesh Verma Responds to Kejriwal's Allegations Amid Election Tensions

Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation - Gadgets 360
summary:
Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Gadgets 360

Evidence has emerged pointing to a significant role played by an ancient geographic hotspot in shaping the Great Lakes. Recent findings suggest that deeper geological processes may have contributed to their formation, providing insight into their extraordinary depth and size.

  • Researchers linked the formation of the Great Lakes to an ancient hotspot that interacted with the Earth's lithosphere millions of years ago.
  • The Cape Verde hotspot is believed to have influenced the Great Lakes region approximately 225 to 300 million years ago.
  • Seismic wave analyses show unusual horizontal wave movement beneath the lakes, indicating lithospheric deformation.
  • These conditions allowed ice to carve deeper and larger depressions, creating the unique landscape seen today.
  • The research reshapes understanding of the Great Lakes' origins, suggesting both deep-Earth processes and surface phenomena played roles in their formation.
“These findings reshape understanding of the Great Lakes' origins.”

The findings indicate a complex interplay between ancient geological processes and glacial activity, illustrating the intricate history behind one of North America's largest freshwater systems.
newTitle: Ancient Geological Hotspot Linked to Great Lakes' Depth and Formation

Yuzvendra Chahal breaks silence hours after Dhanashree's statement amid divorce rumours: 'As a son, brother, friend...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Yuzvendra Chahal breaks silence hours after Dhanashree's statement amid divorce rumours: 'As a son, brother, friend...'

January 10, 2025 | Hindustan Times

India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal posted a lengthy statement on Instagram urging fans not to speculate about his personal life amidst divorce rumours with his wife, Dhanashree Verma.

  • Chahal expressed gratitude to his fans for their support and emphasized that public speculation has caused his family immense pain.
  • His statement avoided direct mention of Dhanashree or details about their relationship.
  • Chahal called for respect and understanding from fans regarding his personal matters.
“As a Son, a Brother and a Friend, I humbly request everyone not to indulge in these speculations, as they have caused immense pain to me and my family.”

Chahal's statement followed Dhanashree's remarks about facing character assassination by trolls, highlighting the challenges they both face in the public eye.
newTitle: Yuzvendra Chahal Addresses Divorce Rumours, Urges Privacy

title: Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark?

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

SN Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen & Toubro (L&T), faced backlash for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays. His remarks sparked a significant response from the public and celebrities alike.

  • Subrahmanyan joined L&T in 1984 and became chairman and MD in October 2023.
  • His comments have been criticized by various stakeholders, including actress Deepika Padukone.
  • Subrahmanyan has overseen several major projects during his tenure at L&T.
  • He has received multiple awards and accolades, including the Eminent Engineer award in 2024.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

The incident has triggered discussions around work-life balance and employee well-being in a corporate context.
newTitle: Who is L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan and Why is He Under Fire?

title: ‘She Appears Irritated’: Netizens Say Kamala Harris ‘Jealous’ After Seeing Obama, Trump Chat - News18
summary:
Netizens Claim Kamala Harris 'Jealous' After Trump and Obama Chat

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: News18

The internet reacted after a viral video showed former president Barack Obama chatting with president-elect Donald Trump at the funeral of Jimmy Carter, while Vice President Kamala Harris appeared to be irritated.

  • Social media was abuzz with reactions concerning Harris' demeanor during the exchange between Obama and Trump.
  • The funeral service took place at the Washington National Cathedral and honored Jimmy Carter, who passed away recently.
  • Comments from social media included observations of how Harris seemed to react negatively to the interaction between the two former presidents.
“Kamala Harris is hated and shunned by everyone. Lovely.” - Alister Clisham

This event has sparked widespread discussion about Harris's position in the current political landscape and her reactions during significant events.
